intro: Althaea minoricensis, commonly known as the Minorca mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Balearic Islands. It is characterized by its hairy, oval-shaped leaves and produces showy pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. It is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes other mallows and cotton plants. Althaea minoricensis is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological importance in its native habitat.
